articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Francis' body will be moved to St Peter's Basilica on Wednesday to allow Catholic faithful to pay their final respects ahead of a funeral expected to bring U.S. President Donald Trump and dozens of other world leaders to Rome.
articles.title: Pope Francis' body lies in state at St Peter's ahead of funeral

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Daphne Psaledakis, John Irish
articles.description: U.S., Ukrainian and European officials meet in London on Wednesday about ending Russia's war in Ukraine after warnings by U.S. President Donald Trump that Washington could walk away if there is no progress on a deal soon.
articles.title: Ukraine, Western countries meet on Russia war as diplomats say breakthrough unlikely

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Twenty-six people were killed and 17 were injured when suspected militants opened fire at tourists in India's Jammu and Kashmir territory, police said on Wednesday, in the worst such attack in the country in nearly two decades.
articles.title: Attack on tourists in Indian Kashmir kills 26 people, injures 17, police say

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney took his election campaign to Quebec on Tuesday, saying only he could protect the predominantly French-speaking province from U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Carney appeals for support in Quebec, promises protection from Trump

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's conservative opposition party leader Peter Dutton, trailing in polls related to the May 3 election, has pledged to boost defence spending to 3% of gross domestic product within a decade, as the Trump administration pushes allies to spend more on security.
articles.title: Australia's conservative opposition leader Dutton pledges defence boost if elected

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: Cambodia should share a feasibility study on the impact of a planned China-backed canal that would divert water from the rice-growing floodplains of Vietnam's Mekong Delta, said the body overseeing the transnational river.
articles.title: Cambodia canal's impact on Mekong questioned after China signs deal

articles.author: Gloria Dickie, Alison Withers
articles.description: More than four-fifths of the world's coral reef areas have been affected by devastating mass bleaching spurred by record-high ocean temperatures, turning many once-colourful reefs a ghostly pale hue, scientific authorities said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Global coral bleaching crisis spreads after hottest year, scientists say

articles.author: Loucoumane Coulibaly, Emmanuel Bruce, Benoit Nyemba
articles.description: Africans are hoping one of their own could become the first Black pope in modern history and build on Francis's legacy of championing the developing world, though the chances of that happening appear slim.
articles.title: Africans root for first Black pope in modern history

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli government shared and then deleted a social media post offering condolences over the death of Pope Francis, without saying why, though an Israeli newspaper linked the decision to the late pontiff's criticism of the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel shares, then deletes, condolences over pope's death

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military launched one of the biggest waves of strikes in Gaza for weeks on Tuesday, residents said, and health officials issued a new warning that healthcare faced total collapse from Israel's blockade of all supplies.
articles.title: Israel steps up Gaza strikes; polio vaccination halted by blockade
